description: remember() called without proper keys, causing stale values or unnecessary recreations. Compose state management issue.
commonCauses: remember() without keys for dynamic values
Missing key when value depends on state
Key doesn't change when value should update
Primitive value as key when object identity needed
Key is unstable class causing recreations
solutions: Add keys for all dependencies: remember(dep1, dep2) { }
Use proper identity for keys (not always same instance)
Include all state dependencies in key list
Mark key classes as @Stable or use primitives
Validate key stability in Compose tests
Use remember without keys only for truly static values
prevention: Always specify keys for remember with dependencies
Use Lint to detect missing keys (compose compiler metrics)
Document why keys are chosen for complex remember blocks
Profile remember cache hits/misses in debug
Review remember usage in code reviews
examples: val processor = remember(patternId, config) { PatternProcessor(patternId, config) }
val list = remember(items.size) { items.toList() } // Stable key
